Sun.title: See the moon cross the Pleiades for the last time this year on July 20
Sun.description: The moon's crescent limb will cloak and uncover stars from the iconic cluster before sunrise.
Sun.author: Joe Rao

Sun.title: Record-breaking high-altitude shot of sun's surface captured from one of Europe's tallest mountains (photo)
Sun.description: "The mountaineer defies gravity; the astronomer looks up. Both seek to reach the unreachable."
Sun.author: Anthony Wood

Sun.title: Scientists extracted water and oxygen from moon dust using sunlight. Could it work on the lunar surface?
Sun.description: "We never fully imagined the 'magic' that the lunar soil possessed."
Sun.author: Keith Cooper

Mercury.title: February new moon 2025: The young moon occults Mercury and passes by Venus
Mercury.description: On Feb. 28, the one-day-old moon will pass in front of Mercury for observers in Australia and the south Pacific, and on March 1 the moon will make a close pass to Venus.
Mercury.author: Jesse Emspak

Mercury.title: See Mercury at its best in the night sky over the next 2 weeks
Mercury.description: Despite its reputation, Mercury is not really that difficult to spot. But March 2025
Mercury.author: Joe Rao

Mercury.title: Mercury looks stunning in images from BepiColombo spacecraft's 6th and final flyby
Mercury.description: "BepiColombo's main mission phase may only start two years from now, but all six of its flybys of Mercury have given us invaluable new information about the little-explored planet."
Mercury.author: Robert Lea

Venus.title: See Venus, the moon and fiery star Aldebaran form a dawn triangle this weekend
Venus.description: Rise and shine! Venus, Aldebaran and the moon team up for a dazzling dawn display.
Venus.author: Joe Rao

Venus.title: Venus is at its farthest from the sun on June 1: Here's how to see the bright 'morning star' this weekend
Venus.description: Venus will rise in the eastern sky in the pre-dawn hours of June 1 alongside Saturn and Neptune.
Venus.author: Anthony Wood

Venus.title: Venus, Saturn and the moon dazzle at dawn in 'romantic' photo from Chew Valley Lake (photo)
Venus.description: It was a race against the rising sun as astrophotographer Josh Dury captured a fleeting cosmic moment before dawn’s light washed the scene away.
Venus.author: Daisy Dobrijevic

Earth.title: This wild bioplastic made of algae just aced a Mars pressure test. Can astronauts use it to build on the Red Planet?
Earth.description: "As this type of technology develops, it's going to have spinoff benefits for sustainability technology here on Earth as well."
Earth.author: Sharmila Kuthunur

Earth.title: 2 new NASA satellites will track space weather to help keep us safe from solar storms
Earth.description: "It's going to help us keep our way of life safe here on Earth."
Earth.author: Keith Cooper

Earth.title: Friday night light: SpaceX launch from California sends two dozen new Starlink satellites into low Earth orbit
Earth.description: Liftoff occurred at 11:52 p.m. EDT on Friday (July 18).
Earth.author: Robert Z. Pearlman

Mars.title: This wild bioplastic made of algae just aced a Mars pressure test. Can astronauts use it to build on the Red Planet?
Mars.description: "As this type of technology develops, it's going to have spinoff benefits for sustainability technology here on Earth as well."
Mars.author: Sharmila Kuthunur

Mars.title: This Week In Space podcast: Episode 169 — The Day Mars Died
Mars.author: Space.com Staff

Mars.title: Twin NASA Mars probes will fly on 2nd-ever launch of Blue Origin's huge New Glenn rocket
Mars.description: The launch of NASA's ESCAPADE mission could take place as soon as Aug. 15.
Mars.author: Mike Wall

Jupiter.title: A doomed exoplanet is caught in a 'death spiral' around its star. Can it survive?
Jupiter.description: "This is an ultra-hot Jupiter, and orbits much closer to its star than any other hot Jupiter ever discovered."
Jupiter.author: Robert Lea

Jupiter.title: 'Pebble' beaches around young stars join together to form planets
Jupiter.description: The huge clouds of pebbles rapidly accrete to form the rocky cores of gas giants like Jupiter.
Jupiter.author: Keith Cooper

Jupiter.title: Trump's 2026 budget would slash NASA funding by 24% and its workforce by nearly one third
Jupiter.description: A number of high-profile missions would get the axe, including the New Horizons Pluto probe and Juno Jupiter orbiter.
Jupiter.author: Mike Wall
